item.description: ⚠️ this article presume you know about the normal law and multivariate normal law Bayes Law $$ \underbrace{\mathbb{P}(Y \mid X)}_{\text {Posterior probability }}=\frac{\overbrace{\mathbb{P}(Y)}^{\text {Prior probability}} \cdot \overbrace{\mathbb{P}(X \mid Y)}^{\text {Likelihood}}}{\mathbb{P}(X)} $$ the denominator is given by $p(x)={p(x|y=1)}p(y=1)+{p(x|y=0)}p(y=0)$
The K-Nearest Neighbours (KNN) algorithm is one of the simplest supervised machine learning algorithms that is used to solve both classification and regression problems.
Linear Regression Pros Quick to compute and can be updated easily with new data Relatively easy to understand and explain Regularization techniques can be used to prevent overfitting
⚠️ this article presume you know about the linear-regression Logistic Regression uses a sigmoid function, also known as the ’logistic function’.
